intro: Stuessya apiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stuessya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Stuessya apiculata is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
